cocktails.name: Mojito
cocktails.description: A refreshing Cuban classic, the Mojito blends white rum with the vibrant flavors of fresh mint, lime juice, sugar, and a splash of soda water. Perfect for a hot summer day.
instructions: In a sturdy glass, gently muddle the mint leaves with simple syrup. Do not shred the mint.
Add the rum and lime juice to the glass.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Top with soda water.
Gently stir to combine all ingredients.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.

cocktails.name: Daiquiri
cocktails.description: The classic Daiquiri is a simple yet elegant cocktail, showcasing the clean taste of rum balanced by the tartness of lime and the sweetness of sugar. A true test of a bartender's skill.
instructions: Add all ingredients to a shaker with ice.
Shake well until thoroughly chilled (about 15 seconds).
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.
Garnish with a lime wheel or twist, if desired.

cocktails.name: Old Fashioned
cocktails.description: A timeless classic, the Old Fashioned is a sophisticated blend of whiskey (typically bourbon or rye), sugar, and bitters, garnished with an orange peel or cherry.
instructions: Place the sugar cube in an old fashioned glass.
Saturate it with Angostura bitters and add a teaspoon of water if desired.
Muddle the sugar cube until dissolved.
Fill the glass with one large ice cube or several smaller ones.
Add the whiskey.
Gently stir for about 30 seconds to chill and slightly dilute.
Express the oils from an orange peel over the drink, then drop it in or discard.
Garnish with an orange peel and optionally a cocktail cherry.

cocktails.name: Whiskey Sour
cocktails.description: A popular and historic cocktail, the Whiskey Sour combines whiskey, lemon juice, sugar, and optionally a dash of egg white for a frothy texture.
instructions: If using egg white, combine whiskey, lemon juice, simple syrup, and egg white in a shaker. Dry shake (without ice) vigorously for about 15 seconds.
Add ice to the shaker and shake again until well-chilled (another 15 seconds).
If not using egg white, combine whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a shaker with ice. Shake well until chilled.
Strain into a chilled coupe or over fresh ice in a rocks glass.
Garnish with an orange slice and a cherry, if desired.

cocktails.name: Moscow Mule
cocktails.description: A buck or mule cocktail, the Moscow Mule is a refreshing mix of vodka, spicy ginger beer, and lime juice, traditionally served in a copper mug.
instructions: Squeeze lime juice into a copper mug (or highball glass).
Add vodka.
Fill the mug with ice.
Top with ginger beer.
Gently stir.
Garnish with a lime wedge.

cocktails.name: Cosmopolitan
cocktails.description: A sophisticated and popular cocktail, the Cosmopolitan blends vodka, triple sec, cranberry juice, and freshly squeezed lime juice for a vibrant pink hue and a balanced sweet-tart flavor.
instructions: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake well until thoroughly chilled.
Strain into a chilled cocktail glass (martini glass).
Garnish with a lime wedge or a flamed orange peel.
cocktails.garnish: Lime wedge or flamed orange peel

cocktails.name: Gin and Tonic
cocktails.description: The quintessential Gin and Tonic is a simple, refreshing highball made with gin and tonic water, often garnished with a lime wedge or slice.
instructions: Fill a highball glass or a large wine glass (Copa de Balon) with ice.
Add the gin.
Top with tonic water.
Gently stir.
Squeeze the lime wedge over the drink and drop it in.
cocktails.glassware: Highball glass or Copa de Balon

cocktails.name: Virgin Mojito
cocktails.description: All the refreshing flavors of a classic Mojito without the alcohol. Fresh mint, lime, sugar, and soda water make for a delightful mocktail.
instructions: In a sturdy glass, gently muddle the mint leaves with simple syrup.
Add the lime juice.
Fill the glass with crushed ice.
Top with soda water or lemon-lime soda.
Gently stir to combine.
Garnish with a mint sprig and a lime wheel.
